title: Waste-to-Energy Plant Moratorium: Cross-Sectoral Systems Map
description: Redirect ₹30K Cr W2E investments to recycling + composting infrastructure

nodes.label: Waste
nodes.description: W2E Moratorium: Redirect investments to recycling + composting

links.quantification: Investment shift → ₹30K Cr W2E funds → recycling infrastructure → 80% material recovery vs. 20% W2E destruction → circular economy
Incineration avoided → dioxin/furan emissions eliminated → cancer risk -60% in adjacent areas → ₹5K Cr health benefits
Recycling economy → 2M waste picker jobs protected (vs. W2E feedstock monopoly) → ₹15K/month wages → livelihood preservation
Power sector opposition: W2E lobby (₹40K Cr investments at risk) → political pressure to continue → renewable energy classification contested
Municipal dependency: Cities contracted to supply 1000 TPD to W2E plants → penalty clauses → lock-in prevents recycling shift
Moratorium → RE investment clarity → ₹30K Cr shifts to actual renewables (solar/wind) → grid decarbonization accelerates (reinforcing)
Requires EPR strengthening: Recycling infrastructure only viable if producers fund material recovery → EPR fee escalation prerequisite
Via pollution reduction: Dioxin elimination → respiratory disease -40% → productivity gains → ₹3K Cr economic benefits
Via material sales: Recycling revenue → municipal tipping fees +₹500/ton → ₹5K Cr/year fiscal benefits vs. W2E gate fees
Via advocacy: Waste picker cooperatives demand recycling infrastructure → political pressure → municipal policy shift toward circularity
